alert.note: Alert for Inland Bryan; Inland Liberty; Long; Tattnall (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 14 at 10:44AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF BRYAN, LIBERTY, LONG AND TATTNALL COUNTIES... At 1043 AM EDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm near Donald, or near Glennville, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...strong winds 45 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar Indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Some locations in the path of this storm include... Hinesville, Glennville, Fort Stewart, McIntosh, Walthourville, Midway, Flemington, and Allenhurst. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: Report damage directly to the Charleston National Weather Service at 888-383-2024 when it is safe to do so. You can also email your report to nws.charlestonsc@noaa.gov.

area.areaDesc: Inland Bryan; Inland Liberty; Long; Tattnall
